hanzi-su-wiki:
錬

Значения

Закаливать, тренировать

Мнемоника

Искажено. Металл 金 с закалкой от лучших восточных 東 мастеров.

Варианты

煉, 錬, 炼, 链
purpleculture_pinyin:
liàn
Japanese variant of 炼
Японский вариант 炼
rtega_mnemonic:
鍊鍊RS
錬錬		smelt metals, forge, refine
  • bag 柬 of metal 金 parts being smelted
  • ⓢ metal 金 being worked on from early in the morning 東
heisig_constituent: tempering, metal, gold, east, tree, wood, sun, day
koohiiStory1: In the East, especially Japan ...there are masters of tempering metal to great strength....on the Spring of Trivia show in Japan I saw how a Japanese sword ...actually split flying bullets...all because of special Eastern tempering techniques.
koohiiStory2: Tempering should be done with the metal facing east. (If not, the metal may pick up the earth´s magnetic field).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The gold from the east needs tempering before it can be sold. The gold from the east is good, it just needs some tempering before it’s entirely presentable. You know, tempering like you’d do in a forge.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine tempering this gold from the east. You’re heat treating the gold when you’re tempering it, so feel the heat from the fire on your face and arms.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The smithy where you’re doing the tempering is pretty fancy, but it’s just a rental (れん). You haven’t sold enough gold to own a smithy as nice as this one yet, so for now, you rent one. It is pretty swanky though, even for a rental.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself in this rental smithy. It’s really nice. There’s like TVs and live music and free WiFi and everything. It’s a very nice rental in which to do tempering. Also keep in mind that this kanji shares its reading with 練, which has the same right side.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, ハ, 并, 日 (день), 木 (дерево), 田 (рисовое поле), 金 (золото)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the eastern (東) gold (金) needs tempering

錬字的基本解释

錬
liàn
同“鍊”（日本汉字）。

錬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［liàn］
“鍊1”的讹字。

錬字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　錬； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1312第09
【集韻】都籠切，音東。【揚子·方言】輨?，趙魏之閒曰錬?。【正字通】說文鐗，車軸頭鐵。集韻或作鍊。又田器。說文：鈐?，大犂也。博雅：錬?，錧也。卽說文鈐?。以此推之，則錬爲鍊之譌也。

錬字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
錬字的起名意思

暂无。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　錬; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1312 Page 09
[Jiyun] All cage cuts, sound east. 【Yangtze Dialect】輨?, Zhao Weizhi Xian said 錬?. [Zhengzitong] Said Wencai, axle head iron. Set rhyme or make chain. You Tian Qi. Said the text: 钤?, the big plow is also. Boya: 錬?, 錧 Ye. Said Wenqian? Inferred from this, the 錬 is the chrysanthemum of the chain.

錬
Name meaning
Nothing.
liàn
яп. вм. 炼
Radicals: 金, 東  (gold, east)
Meaning Mnemonic
The gold from the east needs tempering before it can be sold. The gold from the east is good, it just needs some tempering before it’s entirely presentable. You know, tempering like you’d do in a forge.
Imagine tempering this gold from the east. You’re heat treating the gold when you’re tempering it, so feel the heat from the fire on your face and arms.
Reading Mnemonic
The smithy where you’re doing the tempering is pretty fancy, but it’s just a rental (れん). You haven’t sold enough gold to own a smithy as nice as this one yet, so for now, you rent one. It is pretty swanky though, even for a rental.
Imagine yourself in this rental smithy. It’s really nice. There’s like TVs and live music and free WiFi and everything. It’s a very nice rental in which to do tempering. Also keep in mind that this kanji shares its reading with 練, which has the same right side.
